newsitem.title: USA: Computervision sees Q4 loss, $80 mln revs.
newsitem.headline: Computervision sees Q4 loss, $80 mln revs.

text.p: Computervision Corp said Friday it is expecting a net loss of about $0.09 per share for the fourth quarter, including a non-recurring charge and results from discontinued operations.
The company said it expects about $80 million in revenues from continuing operations for the quarter, compared to $78.7 million in the year-ago quarter.
It also said it will take a non-recurring charge in the quarter of about $14.5 million, or $0.22 per share, for its purchase of British technology company 3rd Angle Ltd.
Before the charge, income from continuing software business operations should be about $0.08 per share, compared to $0.06 per share in the year-ago quarter, the company said.
The company said fourth quarter earnings from its discontinued OSS operations, which are being sold, will be about $0.05 per share.

The Massachusettes-based company said software license revenues should be about $192 million in 1996, up from $163.7 million last year. Total software revenues for the year should be about $300 million, up from $283.4 million.
Wall Street has expected fourth quarter earnings of $0.23 per share for the company, according to First Call consensus estimates.
Computervision closed off 3/8 to 8-3/4 on Thursday.
The company said it would release fourth quarter and full year results on January 28.
